field.name: URL - asset
field.definition: a URL to the resource held in the repository

prompts.prompt: AGU/AMS papers have a 6 month embargo from publication date
Springer papers older than 2014 can be displayed immediately
When moving records with assets, be sure to move the asset

dos.practice: If there are 2 or more assets, add another primaryAsset tag set.

URLs should be constructed like http://nldr.library.ucar.edu/collections/COLL_KEY/filename where the COLL-KEY depends on the computer server directory in the repository to which resource was uploaded and the filename is the name of the uploaded resource. If you are unsure of the COLL_KEY to use, contact an OpenSky Administrator.
For resources made by the U.S. government or in the public domain, OpenSky may hold and post as much or as little of the work as desired.

For resources from non AGU, AMS or Springer publishers, OpenSky has no special agreements and should consult with the author directly about whether a final published version can appear in OpenSky. Assume that it cannot. Then use the relation field to complete a reference to the resource.
For resources from publishers such as AGU, AMS and Springer, OpenSky has a special agreement about what assets may be held. See examples below.

AGU and AMS: OpenSky is allowed to post the published versions 6 months after publication. If the uploaded AMS or AGU paper is less than 6 months from publication, be sure to use the date field (under coverage) to set up a 6 month embargo period.

Springer: OpenSky is allowed to post the published versions immediately but only publications that occur before the year 2014. Any publications after 2014, need to be embargoed until a new agreement is in place.
When moving records with assets, be sure to move the asset.
If you are unsure whether OpenSky should be holding a particular asset, contact an OpenSky administrator and do not give the record a Done status.
